title: Civil service chief says 'lessons will be learned' after row over PM's 'die in a ditch' Brexit speech to police
text:
Britain’s most senior civil servant has said the Prime Minister's Office will "learn lessons" after Boris Johnson was accused of using the police for political purposes during an officer recruitment launch.

Sir Mark Sedwill, the Cabinet Secretary and head of the civil service, said in a letter to Labour that there should have been a "clearer delineation" between the Government policy aspects of Mr Johnson’s speech at West Yorkshire Police last month and political content.

Johnson delivered speech standing in front of 35 police officers at training centre in Wakefield, which led to criticism and the force’s chief constable John Robins saying he was “disappointed” that his officers had been used...
